channel.title: Pages on Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Blog

item.title: About me
item.description: I’m a Manchester based software developer with experience in a range of complex fields. I’m a polyglot programmer who believes in polyglot persistence. I enjoy working with people to tackle hard problems which make a difference. Got something interesting you want to work on together or want to chat about your project? Fill in the form below or tweet me @jjeffries1 [contact-form subject=’[James Jeffries%26#039; Blog’][contact-field label=‘Name’ type=‘name’ required=‘1’/][contact-field label=‘Email’ type=‘email’ required=‘1’/][contact-field label=‘Comment’ type=‘textarea’ required=‘1’/][/contact-form]

item.title: Talks
item.description: From time to time I talk at user groups, conferences or present new ideas to teams at work. This page will list the slides from my talks. There are likely more that I’ve forgotten to list, especially since I started helping run XP Manchester as there’s too many to count. Python Northwest - Using gradual typing to understand legacy code - Jan 2021 Estimates in Context - Lightning Talk - XP Manchester July 2017 A modern agency: applyingÂ lean principles in an agency environment - Lean Startup Manchester - September 2016 Stocks, flows and systems - XP Manchester - May 2016 Running a modern agency - Agile Manchester 2016 Panel Member - DevOops - DevOps Manchester - January 2016 An introduction to network automation - DevOps Manchester - October 2015 Hidden queues - XP Manchester - July 2015 Red, green….
